refnamediv.refpurpose: A single line text entry field

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Implemented Interfaces
refsect1.para: GtkEntry implements AtkImplementorIface, GtkCellEditable and GtkEditable.

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: activates-default gboolean : Read / Write cursor-position gint : Read editable gboolean : Read / Write has-frame gboolean : Read / Write inner-border GtkBorder : Read / Write invisible-char guint : Read / Write max-length gint : Read / Write scroll-offset gint : Read selection-bound gint : Read text gchararray : Read / Write truncate-multiline gboolean : Read / Write visibility gboolean : Read / Write width-chars gint : Read / Write xalign gfloat : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: activate : Run Last / Action backspace : Run Last / Action copy-clipboard : Run Last / Action cut-clipboard : Run Last / Action delete-from-cursor : Run Last / Action insert-at-cursor : Run Last / Action move-cursor : Run Last / Action paste-clipboard : Run Last / Action populate-popup : Run Last toggle-overwrite : Run Last / Action

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkEntry widget is a single line text entry widget. A fairly large set of key bindings are supported by default. If the entered text is longer than the allocation of the widget, the widget will scroll so that the cursor position is visible.

refsect2.title: GtkEntry
refsect2.para: The GtkEntry struct contains only private data.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new entry.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_new_with_max_length ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_new_with_max_length is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkEntry widget with the given maximum length.

Note: the existence of this function is inconsistent with the rest of the GTK+ API. The normal setup would be to just require the user to make an extra call to gtk_entry_set_max_length() instead. It is not expected that this function will be removed, but it would be better practice not to use it.

listitem.simpara: the maximum length of the entry, or 0 for no maximum. (other than the maximum length of entries.) The value passed in will be clamped to the range 0-65536.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_text ()
refsect2.para: Sets the text in the widget to the given value, replacing the current contents.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_append_text ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_append_text is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Appends the given text to the contents of the widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_prepend_text ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_prepend_text is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Prepends the given text to the contents of th ewidget.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_position ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_set_position is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the cursor position in an entry to the given value. This function is obsolete. You should use gtk_editable_set_position() instead.

listitem.simpara: the position of the cursor. The cursor is displayed before the character with the given (base 0) index in the widget. The value must be less than or equal to the number of characters in the widget. A value of -1 indicates that the position should be set after the last character in the entry. Note that this position is in characters, not in bytes.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_text ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the contents of the entry widget. See also gtk_editable_get_chars().

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the contents of the widget as a string. This string points to internally allocated storage in the widget and must not be freed, modified or stored.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_select_region ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_select_region is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Selects a region of text. The characters that are selected are those characters at positions from start_pos up to, but not including end_pos. If end_pos is negative, then the the characters selected will be those characters from start_pos to the end of the text. This function is obsolete. You should use gtk_editable_select_region() instead.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_visibility ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the contents of the entry are visible or not. When visibility is set to FALSE, characters are displayed as the invisible char, and will also appear that way when the text in the entry widget is copied elsewhere.
The default invisible char is the asterisk '*', but it can be changed with gtk_entry_set_invisible_char().

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the contents of the entry are displayed as plaintext.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_invisible_char ()
refsect2.para: Sets the character to use in place of the actual text when gtk_entry_set_visibility() has been called to set text visibility to FALSE. i.e. this is the character used in "password mode" to show the user how many characters have been typed. The default invisible char is an asterisk ('*'). If you set the invisible char to 0, then the user will get no feedback at all; there will be no text on the screen as they type.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_editable ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_set_editable is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Determines if the user can edit the text in the editable widget or not. This function is obsolete. You should use gtk_editable_set_editable() instead.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the user is allowed to edit the text in the widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_max_length ()
refsect2.para: Sets the maximum allowed length of the contents of the widget. If the current contents are longer than the given length, then they will be truncated to fit.

listitem.simpara: the maximum length of the entry, or 0 for no maximum. (other than the maximum length of entries.) The value passed in will be clamped to the range 0-65536.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_activates_default ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the value set by gtk_entry_set_activates_default().

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the entry will activate the default widget

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_has_frame ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_has_frame().

listitem.simpara: whether the entry has a beveled frame

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_inner_border ()
refsect2.para: This function returns the entry's inner-border property. See gtk_entry_set_inner_border() for more information.

listitem.simpara: the entry's GtkBorder, or NULL if none was set.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_width_chars ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_width_chars().

listitem.simpara: number of chars to request space for, or negative if unset

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_activates_default ()
refsect2.para: If setting is TRUE, pressing Enter in the entry will activate the default widget for the window containing the entry. This usually means that the dialog box containing the entry will be closed, since the default widget is usually one of the dialog buttons.
(For experts: if setting is TRUE, the entry calls gtk_window_activate_default() on the window containing the entry, in the default handler for the "activate" signal.)

listitem.simpara: TRUE to activate window's default widget on Enter keypress

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_has_frame ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the entry has a beveled frame around it.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_inner_border ()
refsect2.para: Sets entry's inner-border property to border, or clears it if NULL is passed. The inner-border is the area around the entry's text, but inside its frame.

If set, this property overrides the inner-border style property. Overriding the style-provided border is useful when you want to do in-place editing of some text in a canvas or list widget, where pixel-exact positioning of the entry is important.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_width_chars ()
refsect2.para: Changes the size request of the entry to be about the right size for n_chars characters. Note that it changes the size request, the size can still be affected by how you pack the widget into containers. If n_chars is -1, the size reverts to the default entry size.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_invisible_char ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the character displayed in place of the real characters for entries with visisbility set to false. See gtk_entry_set_invisible_char().

listitem.simpara: the current invisible char, or 0, if the entry does not show invisible text at all.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_alignment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the alignment for the contents of the entry. This controls the horizontal positioning of the contents when the displayed text is shorter than the width of the entry.

listitem.simpara: The horizontal alignment, from 0 (left) to 1 (right). Reversed for RTL layouts

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_alignment ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_alignment().
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_layout ()
refsect2.para: Gets the PangoLayout used to display the entry. The layout is useful to e.g. convert text positions to pixel positions, in combination with gtk_entry_get_layout_offsets(). The returned layout is owned by the entry and must not be modified or freed by the caller.

Keep in mind that the layout text may contain a preedit string, so gtk_entry_layout_index_to_text_index() and gtk_entry_text_index_to_layout_index() are needed to convert byte indices in the layout to byte indices in the entry contents.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_layout_offsets ()
refsect2.para: Obtains the position of the PangoLayout used to render text in the entry, in widget coordinates. Useful if you want to line up the text in an entry with some other text, e.g. when using the entry to implement editable cells in a sheet widget.
Also useful to convert mouse events into coordinates inside the PangoLayout, e.g. to take some action if some part of the entry text is clicked.

Note that as the user scrolls around in the entry the offsets will change; you'll need to connect to the "notify::scroll-offset" signal to track this. Remember when using the PangoLayout functions you need to convert to and from pixels using PANGO_PIXELS() or PANGO_SCALE.

Keep in mind that the layout text may contain a preedit string, so gtk_entry_layout_index_to_text_index() and gtk_entry_text_index_to_layout_index() are needed to convert byte indices in the layout to byte indices in the entry contents.

listitem.simpara: location to store X offset of layout, or NULL
location to store Y offset of layout, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_layout_index_to_text_index ()
refsect2.para: Converts from a position in the entry contents (returned by gtk_entry_get_text()) to a position in the entry's PangoLayout (returned by gtk_entry_get_layout(), with text retrieved via pango_layout_get_text()).

listitem.simpara: byte index into the entry layout text
byte index into the entry contents

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_text_index_to_layout_index ()
refsect2.para: Converts from a position in the entry's PangoLayout (returned by gtk_entry_get_layout()) to a position in the entry contents (returned by gtk_entry_get_text()).

listitem.simpara: byte index into the entry contents
byte index into the entry layout text

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_max_length ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the maximum allowed length of the text in entry. See gtk_entry_set_max_length().

listitem.simpara: the maximum allowed number of characters in GtkEntry, or 0 if there is no maximum.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_visibility ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves whether the text in entry is visible. See gtk_entry_set_visibility().

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the text is currently visible

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_completion ()
refsect2.para: Sets completion to be the auxiliary completion object to use with entry. All further configuration of the completion mechanism is done on completion using the GtkEntryCompletion API. Completion is disabled if completion is set to NULL.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_completion ()
refsect2.para: Returns the auxiliary completion object currently in use by entry.

listitem.simpara: The auxiliary completion object currently in use by entry.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The :activates-default property
refsect2.para: Whether to activate the default widget (such as the default button in a dialog) when Enter is pressed.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The :cursor-position property
refsect2.para: The current position of the insertion cursor in chars.
Allowed values: [0,65535]
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The :editable property
refsect2.para: Whether the entry contents can be edited.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The :has-frame property
refsect2.para: FALSE removes outside bevel from entry.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The :inner-border property
refsect2.para: Sets the text area's border between the text and the frame
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The :invisible-char property
refsect2.para: The character to use when masking entry contents (in "password mode").
Default value: '*'

refsect2.title: The :max-length property
refsect2.para: Maximum number of characters for this entry. Zero if no maximum.
Allowed values: [0,65535]
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The :scroll-offset property
refsect2.para: Number of pixels of the entry scrolled off the screen to the left.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The :selection-bound property
refsect2.para: The position of the opposite end of the selection from the cursor in chars.
Allowed values: [0,65535]
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The :text property
refsect2.para: The contents of the entry.
Default value: ""

refsect2.title: The :truncate-multiline property
refsect2.para: When TRUE, pasted multi-line text is truncated to the first line.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The :visibility property
refsect2.para: FALSE displays the "invisible char" instead of the actual text (password mode).
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The :width-chars property
refsect2.para: Number of characters to leave space for in the entry.
Allowed values: >= -1
Default value: -1

refsect2.title: The :xalign property
refsect2.para: The horizontal alignment, from 0 (left) to 1 (right). Reversed for RTL layouts.
Creates a new GtkEntry widget.
Allowed values: [0,1]
Default value: 0
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The :inner-border style property
refsect2.para: Sets the text area's border between the text and the frame
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The ::activate signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

listitem.para: a widget for handling multi-line text entry.
